title: Great Dismal Swamp -- Project Overview

img.alt: (Photo: In hiding / Bernarda Bryson, 1935, Library of Congress)

description: This project seeks to redraw landscapes through the lens of collective resistance and community. It challenges the notions of patriarchy, capitalism, whiteness, present in landscape by highlighting community driven and centered perspectives of place and space. A legacy that draws upon notions of “petit marronage”, Doreen Massey, and “under commons”. This is project that interweaves leisure, art, and resistance with narratives of black, queer, indigenous, and other normals often left to the fringe -- Where geography meets folklore meets art with a focus on food security and sovereignty.

title: Cooperation Jackson
small: An emerging network of worker cooperatives in Jackson, Mississippi
description:
Cooperation Jackson was formed in 2014 in order to create a city interconnected by democratically-owned worker cooperatives. The organization was issued a cease and desist order as well as a certificate of administrative dissolution in 2022 and can no longer function as a charity, but its broader mission is still preserved as it assists workers in creating cooperatives. They also developed the Fannie Lou Hammer Community Land Trust as an ideological extension of Fannie Lou Hammer's Freedom Farm Cooperative
Sources: https://cooperationjackson.org/

title: Black Farmers' Market
small: A market in Durham and Raleigh focused on Black farmers and food security
description:
Black Farmers' Market arose from Black August in the Park. This event was created in 2015 in the spirit of a Black family reuinion, and eventually hosted a Black vendor fair in 2018. The Black Farmers' Market originated during this event, and was designed to include and support Black farmers. The Black Farmers' Market also evolved into a Black Farmers' Market Trade Union, which is designed to support collective action and community support amongst Black farmers.
Sources: https://blackfarmersmkt.com/

title: Frankie's Outdoor Market
small: A farmer's market staging a food cooperative

img.alt: Northside Food Cooperative and found Cierra Washington

description:
Frankie's Outdoor Market is a farmer's market designed to provide food access to the Northside neighborhood in Wilmington, NC. This neighborhood has traditionally been afflicted by food apartheid, and is the future home of the Northside Food Coop. As the coop is securing funding and being constructed, Frankie's Outdoor Market allows community members to access nutritious food options.
Sources: https://northsidefoodcoop.com/about-the-market/

title: The Federation of Southern Cooperatives
small: An organization providing assistance to coops in the South
description:
This organization provides resources to cooperatives in the South with a specific focus on food cooperatives. It provides administrative resources and networks as well as offering land retention help, which focuses specifically on preventing Black land loss and allowing Black farmowners to retain their land.
Sources: https://www.federation.coop/
title: Land Loss Prevention Project
small: A Durham-based organization to help Black growers retain their farms.

img.alt: The Land Loss Prevention Project Logo

description:
The Land Loss Prevention Project was founded in 1982 to provide direct financial and legal support to Black farmers in order to help them retain their farms.
Sources: https://www.landloss.org/
